promptUsedNoReplies:
You are a requirements analyst auditing discussion forum posts for potential feature requests.
You will be provided with a Moodle discussion forum post that includes the post title and post description. Moodle is a free and open-source learning management system (LMS) used by schools, universities, and workplaces to create online courses and manage learning activities.
Your task is to classify if the provided discussion forum post is a feature request or not for Moodle. A feature request is a post where the user asks for new functionality, missing functionality (e.g., features available in other apps), new content, or changes/improvements to existing features in future releases. Posts that are not feature requests include: bug reports, troubleshooting questions, usage questions, configuration issues, announcements, or general discussions. 
Respond strictly with one of the following labels: FEATURE_REQUEST or NOT_FEATURE_REQUEST. If the forum post is a feature request, return FEATURE_REQUEST. If the forum post is not a feature request, return NOT_FEATURE_REQUEST. Use the title of the post and the description of the post to make the assessment.
Forum Post: 
Post title: Vote for this improvement
Post description: Hello, I've suggested an improvement based on this experience : "When searching a user to enroll in a course, it's not possible to search with [lastname] [firstname] order. It works only by putting [firstname] before [lastname]" If you agree with me, you can vote or comment for this request : https://moodle.atlassian.net/browse/MDL-86597 Or better if you want to add a fix for this ? Thanks in advance Best regards Pascal
Label:

Forum Post: Post title: Need 'Register' button to disappear after user logged in Post description: I am trying to solve a problem, which is not working as per available documentation. In my home page, I have enabled two buttons: 'Log In' and 'Register'. This has been done in Home Page setting - by maintaining caption text. The text has been hyperlinked with the required page. Once the user log in, these two buttons should disappear. HTML appears as below:
Login
Register
To remove the buttons, in advanced settings, in custom SCSS section, maintaining below: .loggedin . row text-center { display: none !important; } But it does not work. Still both the button appears. Any suggestion? I am using Lambda theme. Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: UI Scalability for larger student enrollments
Post description: One of the hallmarks of a good system is scalability. Moodle works well when there is a small learning population. It is however, more challenging and completely manually when there are large training audiences. I prepared a course that required SME review and feedback prior to release. The course has 55 different cohorts, two of which were the SMEs cohorts. I marked the other cohorts as hidden until the SMEs blessed the course's content for release. To unhide each of the cohorts was a complete maddening experience. One at a time and the screen bounced back to the top of the page. No Select All or Unhide All functionality. No letting the admin self-navigate in a very, long page (death scroll). No filters to quickly check that all cohorts were unhidden.
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle 4.5 question bank: how to see total number of questions?
Post description: I would like to ask a question regarding the Moodle 4.5 question bank interface. Is there a way to view the total number of questions directly in the interface? I would like to see the total number of questions, including those in subcategories. This feature has always been very useful, as it was available in Moodle 4.1, but I am unable to find it in the current version. Could someone kindly advise how to access this information? Thank you in advance. Best, susana
Label:

Post title: Assignment Grade button now buried in ellipsis menu
Post description: Are any other organisations frustrated with the new Assignment submissions page where "grade" button has now been buried under the ellipsis submenu? It's one of the core activities of the page and it's lead to so many unnecessary clicks.

Post title: Main menu item incorrectly becomes active when selecting from "More" menu
Post description: Bonjour, There is a display bug in the main menu when it contains submenus. Forum Post: 
Post title: Learning plan templates
Post description: I believe that my Moodle experience is quite different than other Administrators, as I am the only person who comments on the lack of functionality in the Learning Plan Templates (LPT), Learning Plans (LP) and Competencies. Most days, I shrug my shoulders and carry on. Today (yes, this is a rant) I spent over three hours building a learning plan for a new student. this student has unique competency requirements, so it could not be duplicated from an existing LPT. This one single, student has 106 competencies. Adding each competency is an extremely manual process, but worse than that the Learning plan Template view has no automated ordering capabilities. None. Each competency has to be moved, manually using a UI that looks for like a DOS screen than a modern UI. Just having some method for automated ordering would save me hours every week.
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Need to have custom pages for course creation and add course activity by admin or teacher
Post description: I am using IOMAD with Moodle and they have multi tenancy features. I have my own designs and wireframes and i want to have course creation and course activity creation pages according to that. And those pages are completely different than what we already have with Moodle. How can I achieve that. I want to complete re-design of admin side pages with limited functionality.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Course Catalog feature
Post description: Hello Moodle Expert Community, I know many of your are experiencing this very issue as I've seen multiple threads and searches on this topic. Is there any way to have a navigation , course catalog / course grouping like feature in moodle (similar to what Workplace version has: https://docs.moodle.org/500/en/Catalogue ), I would love to know about it. I have been searching day and night for some type of course categorization and filtering feature that would allow end-users to browse courses rather than just have a long list of courses, and I have not found anything yet. Would love to have something for users that can then choose to enroll in those courses (after they filter), and then would also love to use this categorization for users that are auto-enrolled by their organization rules (dynamic cohorts and rules), so that they can also browse the course catalog. Ideally, would be able to select which courses are available for self-enrollment by cohort  which I think should already work, but I have not found a course catalog like plugin or feature to use. Please help. Monika
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add option to control course display on the front page in course settings
Post description: Description Currently, there is no option in the course settings to specify whether a course appears on the Moodle front page for non-enrolled users, even when the course is visible. This requires global configuration changes or moving the course to hidden categories, which is cumbersome for teachers. Proposed Improvement Add an "Show on front page" option in the course settings with: Yes : Course appears on the front page for users with permission . No : Course is visible only to enrolled users and does not appear on the front page. Site default : Follows global site settings.
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Reset course completion criteria without deleting existing completions
Post description: We regularly experience scenarios where customers need to update course completion criteria (for example a new activity has been added), however users with existing completion are not required to complete the new activity. The ability to reset course completion without deleting existing completions would be so valuable and would save hours of work to create new courses and enable completion reports to be run on the same course. I have posted an improvement suggestion and would appreciate if you could vote for it: MDL-84329 Thank you
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Image Aspect Ratios
Post description: This is just a rant to complain about Course Image aspect ratios. They are different in so many places. From the documentation: The recommended image size for a Moodle course is around 400 to 800 pixels. Or 1:2. Here are the aspect ratios in the following areas: My courses - 10 : 7 Recently accessed courses -  191 : 75 Catalogue - 265∶144 Program (Workplace) 3:2 This is frustrating. I believe there are other images that are displayed in different aspect ratios like Program images and badges.
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add "Affected user" filter in course logs
Post description: (I'm not sure if this is the right forum for this, but maybe the usability part?) In the logs one can select user in the filter to view their logs in a course, but what is often wanted - at least for us - is the affected user . And to find that, one has to go through all the log posts. There's a column for Affected user, but no filter. Here is a suggestion to add Affected user as a filter in the logs: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-82080 Please vote if you find that a useful suggestion.
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: comment on the content level
Post description: Hi, I am having trouble finding a good plugin that allows our platform to support comment sections for each content section of the course. For each resource, there's a comment section about that resource. Any ideas?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The core Comment Block does this for content level - add it to the course page, choose the "Any Page" setting, and it will treat the block as unique for the course page and for each activity. However, it does not treat course "Sections" as unique. A 3rd Party plugin to consider for Section pages might be: https://moodle.org/plugins/block_course_discuss - The advantage to this plugin is it puts the discussion "in" the content area instead of a "block" off to the side ( IF your theme supports that).
Comment 2: thank you for the reply it was very helpful, though i would like to know if there's an option where the comment section always get created when a content is created, so i don't have to create it manually each time.
Comment 3: Yes, once the "Comment Block" is added to the course page with the "any page" setting enabled, then all newly added activities would countinue get a copy of that block. For the 3rd party plugin, I do not think so, I think it has to be manually added to each activity, but I've not used it so I can't say for sure. But if you can download it to try it out, then I'd say treat it like the "Comment Block" by try adding it to the course page with the add to "any page" setting (then, add a comment into it on the course page, such as "Course Page Test". Then, add a new activity to the course and see if it that 3rd party plugin automatically is inside the new activity, and see if it is 'blank' or if it includes that "Course Page test" comment.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Learning plan templates
Post description: I believe that my Moodle experience is quite different than other Administrators, as I am the only person who comments on the lack of functionality in the Learning Plan Templates (LPT), Learning Plans (LP) and Competencies. Most days, I shrug my shoulders and carry on. Today (yes, this is a rant) I spent over three hours building a learning plan for a new student. this student has unique competency requirements, so it could not be duplicated from an existing LPT. This one single, student has 106 competencies. Adding each competency is an extremely manual process, but worse than that the Learning plan Template view has no automated ordering capabilities. None. Each competency has to be moved, manually using a UI that looks for like a DOS screen than a modern UI. Just having some method for automated ordering would save me hours every week.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It's way easier with the enrol_Programs plugin, including block_programs. The official version is already enough for most cases. I customized a lot in the plugin and also created an extension for it to fulfill our organizational needs.
Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Course Catalog feature
Post description: Hello Moodle Expert Community, I know many of your are experiencing this very issue as I've seen multiple threads and searches on this topic. Is there any way to have a navigation , course catalog / course grouping like feature in moodle (similar to what Workplace version has: https://docs.moodle.org/500/en/Catalogue ), I would love to know about it. I have been searching day and night for some type of course categorization and filtering feature that would allow end-users to browse courses rather than just have a long list of courses, and I have not found anything yet. Would love to have something for users that can then choose to enroll in those courses (after they filter), and then would also love to use this categorization for users that are auto-enrolled by their organization rules (dynamic cohorts and rules), so that they can also browse the course catalog. Ideally, would be able to select which courses are available for self-enrollment by cohort  which I think should already work, but I have not found a course catalog like plugin or feature to use. Please help. Monika

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add option to control course display on the front page in course settings
Post description: Description Currently, there is no option in the course settings to specify whether a course appears on the Moodle front page for non-enrolled users, even when the course is visible. This requires global configuration changes or moving the course to hidden categories, which is cumbersome for teachers. Proposed Improvement Add an "Show on front page" option in the course settings with: Yes : Course appears on the front page for users with permission . No : Course is visible only to enrolled users and does not appear on the front page. Site default : Follows global site settings.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi It would be a good idea to have this option in core Today, it's possible to use a filtercode tag like {mycoursescards} (displays a series of cards for my enrolled courses) or {mycourses} (isplays an unordered list of links to all my enrolled courses). But it's not this the same basic behaviour

Forum Post: 
Post title: Reset course completion criteria without deleting existing completions
Post description: We regularly experience scenarios where customers need to update course completion criteria (for example a new activity has been added), however users with existing completion are not required to complete the new activity. The ability to reset course completion without deleting existing completions would be so valuable and would save hours of work to create new courses and enable completion reports to be run on the same course. I have posted an improvement suggestion and would appreciate if you could vote for it: MDL-84329 Thank you

Forum Post: 
Post title: Image Aspect Ratios
Post description: This is just a rant to complain about Course Image aspect ratios. They are different in so many places. From the documentation: The recommended image size for a Moodle course is around 400 to 800 pixels. Or 1:2. Here are the aspect ratios in the following areas: My courses - 10 : 7 Recently accessed courses -  191 : 75 Catalogue - 265∶144 Program (Workplace) 3:2 This is frustrating. I believe there are other images that are displayed in different aspect ratios like Program images and badges.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, Amanda! 😊 First of all, could you let me know which theme you are using? Sometimes, the behavior of images can vary depending on the selected theme, as each one may have its own settings and specific dimensions. Additionally, could you share a screenshot of the areas where you notice these differences? This will help us better understand what's happening and find a more targeted solution. Sometimes, the theme's CSS can be adjusted to harmonize proportions and avoid these visual inconsistencies. Eduardo Kraus Teacher and programmer

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add "Affected user" filter in course logs
Post description: (I'm not sure if this is the right forum for this, but maybe the usability part?) In the logs one can select user in the filter to view their logs in a course, but what is often wanted - at least for us - is the affected user . And to find that, one has to go through all the log posts. There's a column for Affected user, but no filter. Here is a suggestion to add Affected user as a filter in the logs: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-82080 Please vote if you find that a useful suggestion.
Comments associated with the post:
